segments.text: I notice the boy is really stretching to reach those cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is wobbling, and I’m afraid he’s going to fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is so eager, but she doesn’t seem to care about the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like they’ve done this before and know they can get away with it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is still drying dishes, completely unaware of the mess around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’s ever going to turn around and see what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is still pouring out, and it’s making the floor so slippery.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the kids don’t slip and hurt themselves.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful compared to the chaos inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I should say something, but I don’t want to ruin their fun.
segments.speaker: PAR
